newsitem.title: UK: Clinton's food choice leaves sour taste-UK gourmet.
newsitem.headline: Clinton's food choice leaves sour taste-UK gourmet.

text.p: A prominent British gourmet on Saturday branded Bill and Hillary Clinton boring provincials after examining the tab for a restaurant meal they shared this week with Prime Minister Tony Blair and his wife.
"You can tell a lot about people from what they eat," said Egon Ronay, founder of the British Academy of Gastronomes and for years publisher of respected restaurant guides.

"Mr Clinton's choice leaves a sour taste in my mouth -- he ordered as if he was eating in the Wild West. And First Lady Hillary ordered her food as if she was sitting in a cheap Italian restaurant at home in Arkansas."
Thursday night's dinner for four at Le Pont de la Tour restaurant overlooking the River Thames rounded off a day's visit to Britain by the U.S. president and his wife.
The Sun newspaper got hold of a copy of the itemised 298.86 pound ($490) bill, splashed it on its front page, and invited Ronay to comment on the choices of the diners.

He praised Tony and Cherie Blair for their cultured ordering from the expensive menu. But he wrote: "The calorie-watching Clintons show a lack of style and a boring, predictable side to their characters."
Ronay said Hillary Clinton's choice of mixed salad without dressing followed by Dover sole and spinach and praline ice cream showed her as basically "unimaginative and straitlaced".
But he reserved his strongest language for the president's choice of what to wash down his seared tuna, wild roast salmon and strawberries with.
"I was horrified to see that in the middle of drinking excellent wines, he really lost the plot and ordered a beer," he said. "Tony Blair also had one -- but only out of courtesy, I think."
